revised_title: Anomalous Dispersion Corrections for Zirconium: A New Measurement Algorithm
tldr: The authors used a scanning X-ray interferometer to measure the forward scattering amplitude for zirconium at various wavelengths near the absorption edge. By employing a new measurement algorithm that utilizes two-wavelength interferometry, they were able to overcome the limitations of previous experiments and obtain accurate results for the anomalous dispersion corrections in zirconium.
